productName: Angolan Muamba de Galinha (Chicken and Palm Butter Stew)
productDescription: A flavorful stew made with chicken, palm butter, vegetables, and spices.
A refreshing drink made from dried hibiscus flowers, often served chilled and sweetened.
Boiled cocoyam mashed with palm oil and spices, served with a flavorful stew.

productName: Congolese Fufu and Ntaba (Cassava Dish with Stew)
productDescription: Fufu, a dough made from fermented cassava, served with Ntaba, a flavorful stew with meat or fish.
A Djiboutian specialty featuring seasoned meat and vegetables cooked in a rich broth.

productName: Eritrean Injera and Shiro Wat (Flatbread & Chickpea Stew)
productDescription: Injera, a spongy flatbread, served with Shiro Wat, a savory chickpea stew seasoned with berbere spice.
Chicken marinated in a flavorful spice mix and cooked with vegetables, known for its spicy kick.
A hearty stew made with corn, beans, vegetables, and meat, a staple dish in Guinea-Bissau.
A staple food in Lesotho, Motoho is a thick porridge made from cornmeal, often served with vegetables or stew.

productName: Liberian Collard Greens with Smoked Fish
productDescription: A flavorful dish of collard greens simmered with smoked fish, onions, and spices.
A flavorful stew made with chicken, berbere spice mix, and vegetables, served with injera (flatbread).
Tender lamb cooked in a tagine with aromatic spices, vegetables, and dried fruits.

productName: South African Bunny Chow (Spicy Curry in Bread)
productDescription: A hollowed-out loaf of bread filled with a flavorful curry, typically with vegetables and meat.

productName: Kenyan Sukuma Wiki (Collard Greens with Meat)
productDescription: A traditional Kenyan dish of chopped collard greens simmered with onions, tomatoes, and meat or fish.
Crispy pastry filled with a savory egg mixture, often with additional ingredients like tuna or potatoes.
A national dish of Senegal featuring fish, vegetables, and rice cooked in a flavorful tomato sauce.
A rich and hearty stew made with meat, vegetables, and a generous amount of peanut butter.
Ripe plantains sliced and fried until golden and crispy, a popular street food.
Small pieces of sweet dough fried until golden brown, a delightful treat.
A variation of Jollof rice with a unique blend of spices and ingredients, often featuring seafood.
